eecs.jago.element
Interface RobotSensors

All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardSensor, StandardSensorFactory
public interface RobotSensors

The types of sensors that can be attached to a StandardRobot.

Since:
5.1

Field Summary
static int COMPASS_SENSOR
          Identifies the sensor as a compass sensor
static int DUAL_LIGHT_SENSOR
          A differential light sensor (to detect direction of light)
static int HIT
          A generic HIT (High Intensity Tracking) Sensor (a dual light sensor)
static int INVERTED_FRONT_BUMPER
          Identifies the sensors as an inverted (ends point forward instead of back) front-mounted bumper.
static int LAST_SENSOR_TYPE
          This value reflects the highest number for a sensor type
static int LEFT_FRONT_BUMPER
          Identifies the sensor as a bumper connected to the left side (Not implemented)
static int LIGHT
          A generic light (contrast) sensor
static int LIGHT_SENSOR
          Identifies the sensor as the light sensor
static int NO_SENSOR
          Indicates no sensor is attached.
static int NOT_CONNECTED
          Value returned when polling an input that does not have a sensor
static int RIGHT_FRONT_BUMPER
          Identifies the sensor as a bumper (touch) sensor connected to the right side (Not implemented)
static int ROTATION
          A generic rotation sensor
static int STANDARD_FRONT_BUMPER
          Identifies the sensor as the front bumper
static int TEMP
          A generic temperature sensor
static int TOUCH
          A generic touch sensor
